newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil gains $4 on Brent, EN590 buying.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil gains $4 on Brent, EN590 buying.

text.p: NWE gas oil firmed nearly $4 a tonne on Thursday on prompt demand for diesel and strong gains on the IPE futures.
A July EN590 cargo traded some 50 cents firmer at $5 a tonne over the IPE basis Le Havre while a first half August cargo traded at $4.65 over.
"The market was firm on the front end but it eased off at the end of the day," said a broker.

He pegged July either side of $4.50 above the IPE for July at the close while swaps talked a similar level. Further forward the swaps market is in contango with August EN590 talked $5.50 and September $6 above the IPE.

Russian cargoes held steady at $1 to $1.75 above the IPE and barges talked 75 cents to $1.50 over for prompt and August loadings in Rotterdam. Antwerp barges talked around 50 to 75 cents above the screen.
Dealers said the strength reflected big gains on crude oil which had lifted forward prices and compressed crack spreads.
"There is a little bit of demand at the front end and the Med is tight but a lot of it was down to crude," said a trader.
In the Mediterranean talk was some $4 a tonne above high quotations.
